references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of Invariant Risk Minimization (IRM), a foundational method for domain generalization that addresses the challenge of training models that generalize well to unseen domains.

references.paper_title: Temporal domain generalization with drift-aware dynamic neural networks
references.reason: This paper addresses the challenge of temporal domain generalization by proposing a novel approach that explicitly models the drift in data distributions over time, contributing significantly to the field of time-series analysis and forecasting.

references.paper_title: Modern koopman theory for dynamical systems
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of Koopman operator theory, a mathematical framework for analyzing nonlinear dynamical systems that is leveraged in the target paper to effectively model the complex dynamics of high-dimensional systems.

This paper introduces Neural Ordinary Differential Equations (NODEs), a novel approach for modeling continuous-time dynamics using neural networks, which is utilized in the target paper to effectively model the continuous evolution of predictive models over time.

This paper proposes a sequential learning framework for domain generalization, which explicitly addresses the temporal dependencies among domains, contributing significantly to the field of temporal domain generalization.
